Recommendations: 1. The Library Manual which contains the Collection Development Policy has to undergo a process. It is suggested that the members of the Library Board Committee may review the Library Manual so this can be presented to the Board of Regents for approval.

2. An additional computer units may be provided at the reading room of the College of Arts and Sciences for internet searching services so users would be able to access free online joumals with full-text articles including electronic books in English language and literature.

3. Latest editions of professional books in English language have to be updated and a continuous acquisition and updating of library resources such as Filipiniana materials and other reference books might also be acquired. CHED Memo No. 52 series of 2007 states that for library holdings, five book titles per professional subject found at the curriculum at a ratio of one student per fifteen volumes enrolled in the program be considered.
